snippet: A company in Dubai bought large amounts of computer equipment from Dell that ended up in Syria despite sanctions, documents show.
abstract: Documents show that company in Dubai purchased large amounts of computer equipment from Dell that ended up in Syria despite sanctions; equipment was sold by BDL Gulf, large Middle East distributor of computer equipment, based in Saudi Arabia; BDL sold equipment to Damascus-based Anas Hasoon Trading, which has contracts to provide computers to Syrian government.
lead_paragraph: A company in Dubai bought large amounts of computer equipment from Dell that ended up in Syria despite sanctions, documents show.

headline.seo: Dell Products Make Their Way, Circuitously, to Syria
headline.main: Outwitting Sanctions, Syria Buys Dell PCs
headline.print_headline: Outwitting Sanctions, Syria Buys Dell PCs
